revised_title: Anatomy of the Central Nervous System in Vertebrate Animals: The Brain of Mormyrids
tldr: The author examines the brain structure of Mormyrids, specifically the Fyleropisus, and discovers unique features such as the organ in front of the cerebellum with wings-like structures. The author also discusses the microscopic anatomy, the structure of the cerebellum, and the origin of various nerves in these fish species.
